pros: Start up culture. Unique, ambitious mission, fantastic people.
cons: Too much up and down. Politics make the decisions, sometimes. But these are typical for start ups.

review_title: Unique opportunity for personal and professional growth.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Talented team, inspiring mission, and systemic impact.
cons: Wish the 100RC project sought/was given more opportunities to diversify funder base beyond founding donor so as to be able to overcome shifts in leadership/focus.

pros: Great mission, great team and culture
cons: Ran out of steam and was wound down.

job_title: Associate Director in New York, NY
pros: Great team and staff, it was a fun place to work.
Great team, really willing to coach through the process
cons: The organization was winding down and future outlooks were very uncertain

review_title: See the world! And not much else.
pros: If you can get one of the jobs where you fly business class, stay in 5 star hotels, eat at the fanciest restaurants, and lecture locals about how "resilience" (still not sure what that is) will solve all their problems, then go for it. The non-travel jobs are mostly focused on supporting the egos and globetrotting of others and creating the 100RC jargon and mythology that only they understand (also, a lot of public relations campaigns and big flashy events where everybody congratulates themselves). Some of the people are nice.
cons: See above. I was going to agree with another review on here but that one seems to have disappeared.

pros: Exciting work with global cities on issues that impact millions of people.  A diverse team of passionate and brilliant people dedicated to the mission. A start-up culture where new ideas and ways of doing things are always considered.
cons: It's a new field so things are always changing. If you like change, this is great but for some people it can be challenging. The start-up culture and heavy travel schedule can lead to long hours at times, but the generous vacation and holiday schedules help balance this out.

job_title: Associate Director in New York, NY
pros:
- highly talented, multi-disciplinary team, great colleagues
- fast paced and diverse work
- great experience working with city governments
- support to define and develop practice area
- great opportunity to innovate
cons:
- program is faced with a change in leadership at the sponsor organization and change in priorities
- program needed more narrowing of focus areas

pros: A lot of Learning if you are open-minded. Most of the time you work by hours instead of a schedule
cons: Too many meetings and some of them are at nonworking hours (this is because they have several offices all around the world, and schedule a meeting is hard because of Time Zones)

pros:
*Incredible opportunity to assist with projects across the world
*Diverse workforce
*Passionate employees
cons:
*This last year was full of internal change on a weekly basis
*Org tries to be transparent with workers but it does not always succeed
*Shifting work priorities and protocols often caused distraction

pros: Fun, lots of room to learn, amazing staff, interesting
cons: There are none - maybe the fact that it is high stress at times but every job is like that.

review_title: Leading city network driven by passionate staff
pros: Meaningful and exciting work. Passionate staff. Great salaries.
cons: Lack of financial sustainability. Many internal processes.
high stress at times, lack of organization
